content: Currently working on #26760. I added an import of Mathlib.Algebra.Equiv.TransferInstance to allow doing the instance transferring through the equivalence. This file doesn't seem to import anything that isn't imported by Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` - i.e. the only difference between them is, in fact, the TransferInstance file itself. But my PR still seems to have been flagged as having a significant increase in transitive imports, and I don't quite understand why. What am I missing?

Not an answer to your question, but Mathlib/InformationTheory/Hamming.lean is a leaf file so nobody is going to worry too much about the increased imports (although this doesn't shed any light on why they increased so much)
Aye, and indeed I am looking at an aggressive refactor because I was the main author on it and that was three years ago and I think it is frankly in need of a revamp.
I assume Mathlib.Algebra.Equiv.TransferInstance imports 70-something files that aren't imported there yet?
Right, but that is just it - I looked at the files it imports and it doesn't seem to be the case.
The declarations have changed but that's because I've changed that file a lot - which is not a change in imports!

Why is it bringing all those in? These are the files that file imports:

import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.Defs
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Equiv.Defs
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.InjSurj
import Mathlib.Data.Fintype.Basic

I thought I already had the contents of all of those, but clearly not.
It makes TransferInstance somewhat cumbersome to use in some ways, then.
Possibly I want to start with Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TransferInstance which seems likely to import less stuff...
Ah I see #26732 is planned to fix this.
And inded, that seems to be why I missed Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TransferInstance three days ago - it didn't exist.
Anyway, I don't think you need to worry about it
I was just concerned about bugs in the script
Yeah I think I must have misread one of the things I was importing, sorry to worry you.
Wrenna Robson has marked this topic as resolved.
